file	name	definition	unit	example	type	min	max	accepted	stics.nameSIM	nbSimulations	Number of simulations (i.e. number of years to simulate)	NA	5	integer	1	100	NA	NASIM	simulationYearStart	Simulation year start. This year must be present in the weather file.	Year	1995	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	simulationDayStart	"Simulation day of year start. Care must be taken when specifying this value to ensure that, for annual crops, all crop activities (sowing, fertilization, irrigation, tillage, harvest, etc.) must occur within 1 year of this day. For example,  if the simulation starts on day 1 (Jan 1), but winter wheat is not sown until day 350, then the crop will only grow for 15 days, with whatever grop is growing in simulation year 2 being initialized at that point. Therefore, the simulation should begin only a short time before the sowing of the initial crop. "	DOY	290	integer	1	365	NA	NASIM	simulationNbrDays	"Number of days per simulation to run (separated with , to change this for each simulation run). Normally, this is left at 365 so that each STICS ""simulation"" spans a full year. However, shorter values can be used to run multiple crops per year, although in this case unit for simulation length is no longer 1 year."	days	365	integer	1	365	NA	NASIM	saveProjectOption	"Option to save project file at end of simulation, which allows continuing a new simulation from this point."	"0 = no, 1 = yes "	1	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	projectFileName	The name of the prj file (exported by a previous Hi-sAFe simulation) from which to initialize this simulation. This is a relative path to the simulation folder. 	NA	Sim_1.prj	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	debugMode	"If 1, prints daily outputs to log file. If 0, only annual outputs are printed to log file."	NA	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	sticsReport	"If 1, a STICS simulation report is exported for each cell in each year. If 0, the reports are not exported. Reports are exported one per year per cell. These reports contain annual water and nitrogen budgets, among other metrics. Exporting reports drastically slows simulations."	NA	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	mainCropSpecies	"Name of the main alley crop plt file. Crop sucession/rotation can be generated by using , to separate multiple file names."	NA	durum-wheat.plt	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	interCropSpecies	"Name of the interCrop plt file for the ""leave area"" within the tree rows. Crop sucession/rotation can be generated by using , to separate multiple file names."	NA	baresoil.plt	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	mainCropItk	"Name of the main alley crop tec file. Crop sucession/rotation can be generated by using , to separate multiple file names. The tec files used here will be applied in the designated year regardless of if the name matches the corresponding plt file."	NA	durum-wheat.tec	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	interCropItk	"Name of the interCrop tec file for the ""leave area"" within the tree rows. Crop sucession/rotation can be generated by using , to separate multiple file names. The tec files used here will be applied in the designated year regardless of if the name matches the corresponding plt file."	NA	baresoil.tec	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	treeCropDistance	"Perpendicular distance from the tree, within which is interCrop and beyond which is mainCrop. If this distance does not end on a cell boundary, the distance is rounded up to the next cell boundary."	m	0.5	real	0	NA	NA	NASIM	treeCropRadius	"Radius around the tree, within which is interCrop and outside of which is mainCrop. If this distance does not end on a cell boundary, the distance is rounded up to the next cell boundary. The method using treeCropDistance takes priority - if treeCropDistance > 0, treeCropRadius is ignored."	m	0	real	0	NA	NA	NASIM	profileNames	Name of profiles to export	NA	"climate,plot,trees,cells, monthCells,roots,voxels"	character	NA	NA	NA	NASIM	exportFrequencies	Export frequencies for each profile	"1=each day, 30=each month, 365=each year"	1	integer	0	365	NA	NASIM	toricXp	Toric symetry of X axis in the positive direction	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	toricXn	Toric symetry of X axis in the negative direction	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	toricYp	Toric symetry of Y axis in the positive direction	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	toricYn	Toric symetry of Y axis in the negative direction	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	treePlantingYears	"Years in which tree planting occurs (separated by ,). Values are applied to trees in the order they are present in the tree initialization table. If extending from a .PRJ file, the year numbering continues from that base simulation!"	simulation year	"1,2"	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	treePlantingDays	"Days of year on which tree planting occurs (separated by ,). Values are applied to trees in the order they are present in the tree initialization table."	day of year	290290	integer	1	365	NA	NASIM	treePruningYears	"Years in which tree pruning occurs (separated by ,). If extending from a .PRJ file, the year numbering continues from that base simulation!"	simulation year	" 2,4,8,10,16"	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	treePruningDays	"Tree pruning days (separated by ,)"	DOY	"365,365,365,365,365"	integer	1	365	NA	NASIM	treePruningProp	"Proportion of tree height (bottom part of tree) on which branches are pruned (separated by ,)"	proportion	" 0.66,0.66,0.66,0.66,0.66"	real	0	1	NA	NASIM	treePruningMaxHeight	"Tree pruning maximum height (separated by ,)"	m	" 6.0,6.0,6.0,10.0,10.0"	real	0	NA	NA	NASIM	treeDensityReduction	"Proportion of branches & leaves that are removed (while keeping the crown volume constant) (separated by ,)"	proportion	" 0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5,0.5"	real	0	1	NA	NASIM	treeThinningIds	"Tree IDs to thin (separated by ,)"	tree id	1	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	treeThinningYears	"Years in which tree thinning occurs (separated by ,). If extending from a .PRJ file, the year numbering continues from that base simulation!"	simulation year	10	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	treeThinningDays	"Day on which tree thinning occurs (separated by ,)"	DOY	365	integer	1	364	NA	NASIM	treeRootPruningYears	"Years in which root pruning occurs (separated by ,). If extending from a .PRJ file, the year numbering continues from that base simulation!"	simulation year	1	integer	1	NA	NA	NASIM	treeRootPruningDays	"Days on which root pruning occurs (separated by ,)"	DOY	365	integer	1	365	NA	NASIM	treeRootPruningDistance	"Perpendicular horizontal distance from the tree row at which root pruning occurs (separated by ,)"	m	1.5	real	0	NA	NA	NASIM	treeRootPruningDepth	"Depth from soil surface to which root pruning occurs (separated by ,). Maximum value is the maximum soil depth. "	m	1	real	0	NA	NA	NASIM	treesLeafLitterIncorporated	"Toggle on/off for the incoproration of tree leaf litter into soil. If 1, tree leaf litter is incorporated into the soil and nutrient cycling dynamics. If 0, tree leaf litter disappears from the system."	0 = off; 1 = on	1	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	treesRootLitterIncorporated	"Toggle on/off for the incoproration of shallow (above humificationDepth) tree root litter into soil. If 1, shallow tree root litter is incorporated into the soil and nutrient cycling dynamics. If 0, shallow tree root litter disappears from the system."	0 = off; 1 = on	1	integer	0	1	NA	NASIM	treesDeepRootLitterIncorporated	"Toggle on/off for the incoproration of deep (below humificationDepth) tree leaf root into soil. If 1, deep tree root litter is incorporated into the soil and nutrient cycling dynamics. If 0, deep tree root litter disappears from the system."	0 = off; 1 = on	1	integer	0	1	NA	NAPLD	latitude	Latitude 	degrees (negative is south of equator)	45	real	-90	90	NA	latitudePLD	elevation	Elevation above sea level	m	100	real	0	2000	NA	altisimulPLD	cellWidth	Cell width 	m	1	real	0	NA	NA	NAPLD	northOrientation	Orientation of North. The tree row is always parallel to the Y axis. 	degrees clockwise relative to the the +Y axis of the scene	90	real	0	359	NA	NAPLD	plotHeight	Plot height (y).	m	100	real	0	NA	NA	NAPLD	plotWidth	Plot width (x).	m	100	real	0	NA	NA	NAPLD	slopeIntensity	Magnitude of the slope of the soil surface (only used by the light module)	degrees downward from horizontal	10	real	0	90	NA	NAPLD	slopeAspect	Aspect of the slope of the soil surface (only used by the light module)	degrees clockwise from North that the slope goes downward	90	real	0	359	NA	NAPLD	voxelThicknessMax	Maximum allowed thickness of a voxel when automatically splitting specified layers into voxels.	m	0.2	real	0	NA	NA	NAPLD	humificationDepth	Depth of soil humification zone (soil depth with an active biological activity).	m	0.4	real	0.1	1.5	NA	profhumPLD	albedo	Albedo for dry bare soil 	ratio	0.2	real	0.05	0.6	NA	albedoPLD	cropRootObstruction	Soil depth at which CROP root growth is stopped due to physical constraints	m	3.2	real	0.1	10	NA	obstaracPLD	ph	Initial soil pH (water solution). Applies to all soil layers.	unitless	8.4	real	4	9	NA	pHPLD	swellingClaySoil	Toggle on/off the option to activiate an additional water compartment for swelling soils	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	codefentePLD	macroporosity	Toggle on/off the calculation of water flux in soil macroporosity	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	codemacroporPLD	soilCrustRainMin	Minimum amount of rain required to create a soil crust (inactive if the STICS vigueurbat parameter is equal to 1)	mm day-1	50	real	5	100	NA	pluiebatPLD	soilCrustDepth	Mulch depth from which a crust occurs (inactive if the STICS vigueurbat parameter is equal to 1)	cm	0.5	real	0	2	NA	mulchbatPLD	roughnessLength	Roughness length of bare soil	m	0.01	real	0.01	0.2	NA	z0solnuPLD	soilHumusCN	Initial C to N ratio of soil organic matter from the surface down to the humificationDepth. Used to initialize soil organic carbon via organicNitrogen.	ratio	12.2	real	8	20	NA	CsurNsolPLD	waterTable	Toggle on/off the inclusion of a water table 	0 = off; 1 = on	1	integer	0	1	NA	NAPLD	evaporationValue	Cumulative soil evaporation above which evaporation rate is decreased 	mm	9	real	0	50	NA	q0PLD	evaporationMaxDepth	Maximum soil depth affected by soil evaporation	cm	60	real	0	150	NA	zesx   PLD	evaporationDepthContribution	Parameter defining the soil contribution to evaporation versus depth 	unitless	5	real	0.5	NA	NA	cfesPLD	runOffCoefPlantMulch	Runoff coefficient taking account for plant mulch	unitless	0.33	real	0	5	NA	penteruiPLD	rainRunOffFraction	Run off fraction (relative to total rainfall) in bare soil 	ratio	0.2	real	0	1	NA	ruisolnuPLD	capillary	Toggle on/off the inclusion of capillary rise at the base of the soil profile. Only used if macroporosity == 1 as well. 	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	coderemontcapPLD	capillaryUptake	Capillary rise upward water flux. Only used if capillary == 1 and macroporosity == 1.	g water / g soil	0.3	real	0	10	NA	humcapilPLD	artificialDrainage	Toggle on/off the inclusion of artificial drainage (pipes). If true, nitrification is calculated daily. If false, all NH4 is assumed to be nitrified to NO3 each day."	0 = off; 1 = on	1	integer	0	1	NA	codenitrifPLD	denitrification	Toggle on/off to activate a more mechanistic calculation of denitrification via the NEMIS model.	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	codedenitPLD	denitrificationDepth	Soil depth on which denitrification is active. Turtle option is faster, but less accurate. "	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NAHISAFE	cropLightMethod	"Toggle for selecting which light module to use. If 0, light is calculated by STICS. If 1, light is calculated by Hi-sAFe. MUST BE 1 FOR Hi-sAFe TO WORK."	0 = off; 1 = on	0	integer	0	1	NA	NAHISAFE	timeStep	Number of hours between two calculations of the sun's position. Only used if turtleOption == 0.	hours	0.5	real	0	24	NA	NAHISAFE	nbTimeStepMax	"Maximum number of time step calculation per day. If the number of time steps calculated using timeStep is greater than this value, then this maximum value is used instead. Only used if turtleOption == 0."	NA	100	integer	0	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	diffuseAngleStep	Angle step between two beams. Only used if turtleOption == 0.	degrees	15	real	0	180	NA	NAHISAFE	declinationThreshold	"The threshold change in sun declination that triggers a recalculation of the light module. If the sun declincation does not change by more than this threshold, then the light module calculations from the previous day are used. If the tree leaf area does not change by more than this threshold, then the light module calculations from the previous day are used. Approximation by photosyn assistant (Dundee Scientific Ltd).	MJ mol-1	0.217	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	aangst	Angstrom coefficients for calculating insolation	unitless	0.18	real	0.0001	0.9	NA	aangstHISAFE	bangst	Angstrom coefficients for calculating insolation	unitless	0.62	real	0	1	NA	bangstHISAFE	priestleyTaylorCoeff	Priestley-Taylor Coefficient	unitless	1.26	real	1	2	NA	alphaptHISAFE	sigma	Stefan-Boltzman constant	W m-2 T-4	5.67E-08	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	gamma	Psychrometric constant	mbar degreeC-1	0.65	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	integrationStep	Used in calculation of Phi_pF.	NA	0.1	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	maxPhiPF	Used in calculation of Phi_pF.	NA	6	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	maxTempSnow	Rain is transformed to snow when Tmax is less than this value.	degreeC	3	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	minTempSnow	Rain is transformed to snow when Tavg is less than this value.	degreeC	0	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	maxDailySnowMelt	Maximum amount of snow that can melt each day.	mm	10	real	0	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	maxTempSnowMelt	Snow melt occurs at a rate of maxDailySnowMelt mm per day when Tavg is this value.	degreeC	10	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	minTempSnowMelt	Snow melt does not occur when Tavg is below this value.	degreeC	2	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	sticsWaterExtraction	Code to select which water module to use for the CROP.	0 = Hi-sAFe; 1 = STICS	0	integer	0	1.00E+00	NA	NAHISAFE	laiFileName	Name of file for daily crop LAI forcing (for water extraction calibration). Should be commented out unless it is intended for use.	NA	 lai.obs	character	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	nitrogenDiffusionConstant	"Nitrogen diffusion constant. Used in: nitrogenDiffusionFactor = theta * max(theta, theta * nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA1 + nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA0)"	cm2 day-1	1	real	0	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA0	"Nitrogen Effective Diffusion A0 .Used in: nitrogenDiffusionFactor = theta * max(theta, theta * nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA1 + nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA0)"	unitless	-0.011	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA1	"Nitrogen Effective Diffusion A1. Used in: nitrogenDiffusionFactor = theta * max(theta, theta * nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA1 + nitrogenEffectiveDiffusionA0)"	unitless	0.15	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	no3AbsorptionConstant	NO3 Absorption Constant. Used in: absorptionConstant = ((no3AbsorptionConstant + theta) * (nh4AbsorptionConstant + theta)) / (no3AbsorptionConstant + theta + no3Fraction  * (nh4AbsorptionConstant - no3AbsorptionConstant)) - theta	unitless	0.3	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	nh4AbsorptionConstant	NH4 Absorption Constant. Used in: absorptionConstant = ((no3AbsorptionConstant + theta) * (nh4AbsorptionConstant + theta)) / (no3AbsorptionConstant + theta + no3Fraction  * (nh4AbsorptionConstant - no3AbsorptionConstant)) - theta	unitless	5	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	no3Fraction	Fraction of NO3. Used in: absorptionConstant = ((no3AbsorptionConstant + theta) * (nh4AbsorptionConstant + theta)) / (no3AbsorptionConstant + theta + no3Fraction  * (nh4AbsorptionConstant - no3AbsorptionConstant)) - theta	unitless	0.6	real	NA	NA	NA	NAHISAFE	fmin1	Relative potential mineralization rate in deep mineralizatio module: K2 = fmin1 * exp(-fmin2*argi) / (1+fmin3*calc)	d-1	0.65	real	0	1	NA	fmin1HISAFE	fmin2	Parameter defining the effect of clay on the potential mineralization rate in deep mineralizatio module: K2 = fmin1 * exp(-fmin2*argi) / (1+fmin3*calc)	-1%	11	real	0	1	NA	fmin2HISAFE	fmin3	Parameter defining the effect of CaCO3 on the potential mineralization rate in deep mineralizatio module: K2 = fmin1 * exp(-fmin2*argi) / (1+fmin3*calc)	-1%	60	real	0	1	NA	fmin3HISAFE	aclim	climatic component of A to calculate actual soil evaporation	mm	20	real	4	25	NA	aclimHISAFE	aks	parameter of calculation of the energetic loss between the inside and the outside of a greenhouse 	W m-2 K-1	6	real	0.01	1.00E+02	NA	aksHISAFE	albveg	albedo of the vegetation	unitless	0.23	real	0.05	0.3	NA	albvegHISAFE	altinversion	altitude of inversion of the thermal gradient	m	500	real	0	2000	NA	altinversionHISAFE	altistation	altitude of the input metorological station 	m	130	real	0	2.00E+03	NA	altistationHISAFE	bks	parameter of calculation of the energetic lost between the inside and the outside of a greenhouse 	W m-2 K-1	0.5	real	0	1.00E+02	NA	bksHISAFE	cielclair	fraction of sunny hours allowing the inversion of thermal gradient with altitude	unitless	0.8	real	0	1	NA	cielclairHISAFE	codadret	option to calculate mountain climate taking into account the orientation 	code 1/2; 1 = south	1	integer	1	2	NA	codadretHISAFE	codaltitude	option to activate the calculation of the climate in altitude 	"1 = no, 2 = yes"	1	integer	1	2	NA	codaltitudeHISAFE	codecaltemp	option to activate the use of crop temperature for phasic development calculation 	"1 = empirical relation, 2 = energy balance"	1	integer	1	2.00E+00	NA	codecaltempHISAFE	codeclichange	option to activate climate change 	"1 = no, 2 =yes"	1	integer	1	2.00E+00	NA	codeclichangeHISAFE	codeetp	Option for the method of calculating PET. THIS MUST BE 1 FOR HI-AFE TO WORK.	"1 = forced Penman, 2 = calculated Penman, 3= Shuttleworth & Wallace, 4 = Priestley & Taylor"	1	integer	1	1	NA	codeetpHISAFE	codernet	option of calculation of net radiation 	"1 = Brunt's method, 2 = carbon that is allocated to colonisation (only on days when there is any colonisation). The remainder is allocated to proliferation. This is typically a small proportion - just enough to ""seed"" the newly colonized voxels. This proportion of carbon is split equally among all newly colonized voxels. DOY"		real	0	NA	NA	julapNTEC	qte	Fertiliser quantity	"If codefracappN = 1: Kg N ha-1If codefracappN = 2: percentage of  Qtot_N"		real	0	NA	NA	qteTEC	codlocferti	option to code of fertilisation localisation	"1= on soil surface, 2 = in soil"		integer	1	2	NA	codlocfertiTEC	locferti	soil depth at which fertiliser is applied	cm 		integer	0	30	NA	locfertiTEC	codrecolte	Option for triggered harvest	1=physiologic maturity 2=water content 3=sugar 4=nitrogen 5=oil		integer	1	5	NA	codrecolteTEC	ressuite	Type of residue after harvest	Pool names		character	NA	NA	"roots, whole_crop, stubble+roots, straw+roots"	ressuiteTEC	codceuille	option of harvest type 	"1 =single harvest (cutting), 2 = multiple harvests (picking)"		integer	1	2	NA	codceuilleTEC	nbceuille	number of fruit harvestings 	"1= one at the end, 2 = many during the cycle"		integer	1	2	NA	nbceuilleTEC	cadencerec	number of days between two harvests			integer	1	30	NA	cadencerecTEC	codeaumin	option to activate the harvest as a function of grain/fruit water content	1=minimum 2=maximum		integer	1	2	NA	codeauminTEC	h2ograinmin	min water content in fruits at harvest	g water g MF -1		real	0.05	1	NA	h2ograinminTEC	h2ograinmax	max water content in fruits at harvest	g water g MF -1		real	0.05	1	NA	h2ograinmaxTEC	sucrerec	min sugar content at harvest	g MF -1		real	0.0001	0.5	NA	sucrerecTEC	CNgrainrec	nitrogen concentration in grains for harvest	0-1		real	0	1	NA	CNgrainrecTEC	huilerec	min oil content at harvest	g oil g MF -1		real	0.1	1	NA	huilerecTEC	coderecolteassoc	"option to harvest intercrop species simultaneously, at the physiological maturity date of the earliest one "	"1 = no, 2 = yes"		integer	1	2	NA	coderecolteassocTEC	codedecirecolte	option to activate moisture and frost effects on harvest decision 	"1 = yes, 2 = no"		integer	1	2	NA	codedecirecolteTEC	nbjmaxapresrecolte	maximal delay allowed for harvest (number of days) (if the soil compaction option is to make a cut of forage crop			real	1	10	NA	mscoupeminiTEC	codemodfauche	option defining the cut mode 	"1 = automatic calculation depending on phenologic and trophic state,  2 = pre-established 		integer	1	3	NA	codepaillageTEC	couvermulchplastique	fraction of soil covered by the plastic mulch 			real	0	1	NA	couvermulchplastiqueTEC	albedomulchplastique	albedo of plastic
